thread.title_full: Saguenéens Honor 20-Year-Old Players in Celebration Match March 21

author: BVM Sportsdesk
title: Saguenéens Honor 20-Year-Old Players in Celebration Match March 21
text:
Saguenéens Honor 20-Year-Old Players in Celebration Match March 21
On March 21, 2025, the Chicoutimi Saguenéens will honor their 20-year-old players at the Centre Georges-Vézina. This annual tradition celebrates the junior careers of Félix Gagnon, Kassim Gaudet, and Loïc Usereau with special recognition for their hard work and leadership in the LHJMQ. Each player will be honored alongside family members during the match, highlighting their perseverance and commitment to excellence in hockey.
- Félix Gagnon: 59% faceoff win rate in his LHJMQ career.
- Kassim Gaudet: Captain for both the Remparts in 2023-24 and Saguenéens in 2024-25.
- The Saguenéens have showcased consistent performance, with significant contributions from veteran players.
- Gagnon and Usereau have participated in NHL training camps, demonstrating their potential at the professional level.
The Saguenéens aim to build on their successful season by leveraging the experience of their senior players in upcoming matches, while Gagnon, Gaudet, and Usereau prepare for their next steps in hockey, whether in college or the pros.
Bottom LineThe March 21 celebration is not just a tribute to the players but a recognition of their journey and contributions to the team, instilling a strong sense of leadership and culture in the organization. Fans are encouraged to attend and support these athletes as they transition from junior to their next chapters.
Read more at Sagueneens de Chicoutimi
